programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Indulge in chocolate mastery as The Chocolate Queen dazzles once again! Kirsten showcases her steamed mousse cake, a boozy chocolate rum baba, and a classic French favourite: Paris-Brest. She also explains why biscuits spread during baking and how to perfect them every time.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Dive into chocolate delights in this unmissable episode! Kirsten crafts hazelnut torrone, chocolate-orange financiers, and minty chocolate biscuits. Plus, she shares a clever and easy dessert recipe to make the most of your leftover pastry.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today we’re in Brighton and Hove where Indian vegetarian restaurant Planet India kick start the competition with chef Neez and front of house Ahmad cooking up some cosy vegan curries from mum and dad's special recipes.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey land in the food mecca of Tokyo and find them selves being auctioned off for a charity. - In the city that boasts the most michelin stars in the world, the Maketu sisters start tasting some serious dishes, from the best Ramen in Japan to a 20-course kaiseki lunch and michelin star sushi. - But it’s their final night that sees them pushed to their limits as they’re in a working kitchen feeding hungry guests who won their services in the ‘Support our Kids’ charity auction.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: In their final destination, Karena and Kasey are in the Pacific visiting New Zealand’s closest neighbour, New Caledonia. - It’s a perfect foodie fusion between Pacific island produce and French cooking techniques. Where else can you eat pastries, baguettes, snails, and cheese under palm trees by crystal clear waters. - One of the sisters gets an exclusive lesson with one of the island's top chefs, while the other heads to the beautiful Isle des Pins. - After learning all about sustainability of the ocean, Karena and Kasey hope to impress a group of savvy New Caledonian foodies.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: It's grace under pressure as the home cooks attempt to wow a star-studded - wall of chefs.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: A home cook tries to rewrite the rules of mixing seafood and dairy in the Crowd-Pleaser round, and everyone tries to make magic out of the romano beans in Chef Susur Lee’s fridge.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha's exploring the family feasts of China with chef Jeremy Pang. Dishing up sensational street food snack Jianbing for breakfast, Prawn Toasts with Smacked Cucumber for lunch, Jeremy's in charge of dinner with his Claypot Chicken and Mushroom Rice and Nadia's finishing off with Banana Fritters for dessert!

programme.title: Cook Like An Italian
programme.sub-title: Grandma hacks that make a difference
programme.desc: Every Italian cook has ‘grandma hacks’ or ‘party tricks’ passed down from their Mamma and it’s these little hacks that make all the difference. Most of these recipes you’ll be familiar with, but these slight twists make the cooking process faster and are bound to impress those guests you’ve been promising to have over for months!

programme.title: Cook Like An Italian
programme.desc: You cannot go wrong with these favourites which will of course be enjoyed by the whole family – even if you have some fussy eaters in the house! The ingredients are simple, yet full of flavour and the recipes have been refined to the point of perfection as they’ve passed down the generations.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley takes inspiration from days beside the seaside. Starting with his “caribbean squash and chickpea roti with hot sauce yoghurt.” Bake Off winner, Candice Brown, brings all the fun of the fair with her naughty “toffee apple doughnuts.” Ainsley cooks up his take on a beachside classic for mate and comedian Alan Davies with his “crispy fish cakes,” “garden pea crush,” and “sweet potato wedges.” Olly Smith has hunted out the perfect wines for sipping by the seashore. And no trip to the beach would be complete without some ice cream. Luckily Ainsley has just the ticket with his “homemade honeycomb ice cream sundae with butterscotch sauce.”

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson shows how to turn a bar or square into an elegant plated dessert and she bakes up three different and delicious styles.

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson get nostalgic and bakes up some delicious turnovers. She starts simple and finishes up with a flaky spectacular treat.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Indulge in chocolate mastery as The Chocolate Queen dazzles once again! Kirsten showcases her steamed mousse cake, a boozy chocolate rum baba, and a classic French favourite: Paris-Brest. She also explains why biscuits spread during baking and how to perfect them every time.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Dive into chocolate delights in this unmissable episode! Kirsten crafts hazelnut torrone, chocolate-orange financiers, and minty chocolate biscuits. Plus, she shares a clever and easy dessert recipe to make the most of your leftover pastry.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today we’re in Brighton and Hove where Indian vegetarian restaurant Planet India kick start the competition with chef Neez and front of house Ahmad cooking up some cosy vegan curries from mum and dad's special recipes.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha's galavanting off to Greece to discover a family feast with London's youngest Michelin starred chef Asimakis Chaniotis. Featuring Greek Scrambled Eggs for breakfast, Chicken Gyros for lunch, Asimakis makes his mum's Meatball Soup for dinner and Nadia rustles up some Greek Almond Crescent Biscuits to enjoy for dessert.

programme.title: Asia Unplated
programme.desc: Diana goes Japanese: starting with her recipe for ‘Okonomiyaki’, created using ingredients found in your fridge and pantry. Next stop is meeting owner and chef at Mr. Miyagi, a popular Melbourne restaurant that has a new take on traditional Japanese food. Cooking together with chef Daisuke Miyake (Shinoki restaurant) and finishing up with her own version of ‘Nasu Dengaku’ or miso baked eggplant, to celebrate iconic Japanese umami flavour.

programme.title: Asia Unplated
programme.desc: Diana decides to focus on the foods of Northern India. Inspired by heavy curries and fragrant spices, Diana cooks a traditional ‘Lamb Korma’. Prominent chef Adam D'Sylva (Tonka and Coda) shares his ‘Bengali Fish Curry’, a lighter dish. For something sweet, Diana cooks a rice pudding with fragrant northern Indian spices called ‘Kheer’.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: A home cook tries to rewrite the rules of mixing seafood and dairy in the Crowd-Pleaser round, and everyone tries to make magic out of the romano beans in Chef Susur Lee’s fridge.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Lamb has a reputation only for fine dining but it is much more accessible than that. Jenn trims hooves, makes lamb kofte, and enjoys a slow braised leg of lamb.
